usefulItems: baking paper, pastry brush, large baking tray, oven
title: Salmon Filo Spiral

ingredients.content: ¼ - ½ fresh red chilli, to taste
300 g fresh salmon fillets, skinless, cut in pieces
12 sheets filo pastry, plus extra as needed

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 200°C and line a large baking tray with baking paper. Place a long sheet of baking paper (130 cm) on a work surface.
Place butter in mixing bowl and melt <b>2 min 30 sec/80°C/speed 2<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place parsley and chilli in mixing bowl then chop <b>2 sec/speed 6<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then chop again <b>2 sec/speed 6<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add spinach, cream cheese, lemon juice and salt then, with aid of spatula, mix <b>10 sec/speed 6<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add pecans and salmon then mix <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>.

Working as quickly as possible to avoid pastry drying out, lay 3 sheets filo pastry end-to-end on long sheet of baking paper then brush generously with reserved melted butter. Lay another 3 sheets filo pastry on top and brush with more melted butter. Repeat for 2 more layers, brushing generously with melted butter after each layer.

Evenly distribute salmon mixture along one long side of pastry sheets forming a long log. Brush remaining exposed pastry with melted butter, then carefully roll pastry into a long sausage shape to encase filling. Coil pastry around itself into a spiral, brushing with extra melted butter as needed, then transfer to prepared tray.
Patch up any breaks in pastry with small pieces of filo and melted butter.
Bake for 30-40 minutes (200°C) until pastry is golden and crispy. Cut in wedges and serve hot.

hintsAndTricks: A creative way to use salmon, this dish will impress everyone at your dinner table. It's a great option when introducing fish to fussier eaters as combining cream cheese and crunchy pecan nuts gives the salmon a milder flavour. Cut the flaky pastry spiral into wedges and serve with a fresh green salad,
